javadoc: Base class for data type managers.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a temporary data-type manager.
 Note that this manager does not support the save or saveAs operation.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a temporary data-type manager.
 Note that this manager does not support the save or saveAs operation.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructor for a data-type manager backed by a packed database file.
 When opening for UPDATE an automatic upgrade will be performed if required.

params.name: openMode
params.comment: open mode CREATE, READ_ONLY or UPDATE (see DBConstants)

throws.comment:
a low-level IO error.  This exception may also be thrown
 when a version error occurs (cause is VersionException).

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor

params.name: addrMap
params.comment: map to convert addresses to longs and longs to addresses

methods.javadoc:
Build Parent/Child table for tracking dataType usage
 by other dataTypes (e.g., arrays, pointers, etc.).
 Only used to populate the ParentChildAdapter table
 following an upgrade because it did not previously exist.
 This could not be accomplished by the adapter during
 instantiation because we must be able to instantiate
 all dataTypes to accomplish this.
methods.name: initializedParentChildTable
methods.comment:
Build Parent/Child table for tracking dataType usage
 by other dataTypes (e.g., arrays, pointers, etc.).
 Only used to populate the ParentChildAdapter table
 following an upgrade because it did not previously exist.
 This could not be accomplished by the adapter during
 instantiation because we must be able to instantiate
 all dataTypes to accomplish this.

methods.javadoc:
Get the category for the given ID.
@return null if no category exists with the given ID.
methods.name: getCategory
methods.comment: Get the category for the given ID.

return.comment: null if no category exists with the given ID.

methods.name: resolveNoSourceDataType
methods.comment:
Either finds an equivalent dataType with the same categoryPath and name (or conflict name)
 to the given dataType. Otherwise, it creates a new dataType in this archive equivalent to
 the given dataType. If a dataType exists with same path and name but is not equivalent, the
 handler will resolve the problem in one of 3 ways.
  1) A new dataType will be created, but with a .conflict name
  2) The existing dataType will be replaced by a resolved copy of the given dataType.
  3) The existing dataType will be returned instead of a resolved version of the given dataType.

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the dataType for which to return an equivalent dataType in this manager

params.name: handler
params.comment: Used to handle collisions with dataTypes with same path and name that is

methods.name: getUnusedConflictName
methods.comment:
This method gets a ".conflict" name that is not currently used by any data types
 in the indicated category of the data type manager.

params.name: path
params.comment: the category path of the category where the new data type live in the data type manager.

params.name: name
params.comment:
The name of the data type. This name may or may not contain ".conflict" as part of it.
 If the name contains ".conflict", only the part of the name that comes prior to the ".conflict"
 will be used to determine a new unused conflict name.

methods.name: findEquivalentDataTypeSameLocation
methods.comment:
Finds an datatype in this manager that is equivalent and has the same categoryPath and has
 either the same name or a conflict variation of that name.

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the dataType for which to find an equivalent existing dataType

params.name: excludedName
params.comment: exclusion name to never match on or null

methods.name: replaceSourceArchive
methods.comment:
Replace one source archive (oldDTM) with another (newDTM). Any data types whose source
 was the oldDTM will be changed to have a source that is the newDTM.  The oldDTM will no
 longer be referenced as a source by this data type manager.

methods.name: removeInternal
methods.comment: Remove the given datatype from this manager (assumes the lock has already been acquired).

methods.javadoc:
Remove all function signature parameters from the data base that have the indicated parent.
@param parentID the parentData type's ID
methods.name: removeParameters
methods.comment: Remove all function signature parameters from the data base that have the indicated parent.

methods.javadoc:
Remove all components from the data base that have the indicated parent.
@param parentID the parentData type's ID
methods.name: removeComponents
methods.comment: Remove all components from the data base that have the indicated parent.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the datatypes in the given category path
@param path the category path in which to look for datatypes
methods.name: getDataTypes
methods.comment: Gets the datatypes in the given category path

params.name: path
params.comment: the category path in which to look for datatypes

methods.name: createPointer
methods.comment: Create a new pointer data-type

params.name: length
params.comment: fixed pointer length or -1 for dynamically sized pointer

methods.javadoc:
Handles IOExceptions
@param e the exception to handle
methods.name: dbError
methods.comment: Handles IOExceptions

methods.name: dataTypeCategoryPathChanged
methods.comment: Notifys the category path changed

methods.javadoc: Invalidates the cache.
methods.name: invalidateCache
methods.comment: Invalidates the cache.

methods.name: setLongSettingsValue
methods.comment: Set the long value for instance settings.

return.comment: true if the settings actually changed

methods.name: setStringSettingsValue
methods.comment: Set the string value for instance settings.

return.comment: true if the settings actually changed

methods.name: setByteSettingsValue
methods.comment: Set the byte array value for instance settings.

return.comment: true if the settings actually changed

methods.name: setSettings
methods.comment: Set the Object settings.

params.name: value
params.comment: the value for the settings, must be either a String, byte[] or Long

methods.name: getLongSettingsValue
methods.comment: Get the long value for an instance setting.

return.comment: null if the named setting was not found

methods.name: getStringSettingsValue
methods.comment: Get the String value for an instance setting.

return.comment: null if the named setting was not found

methods.name: getByteSettingsValue
methods.comment: Get the byte array value for an instance setting.

return.comment: null if the named setting was not found

methods.name: getSettings
methods.comment: Gets the value of a settings as an object (either String, byte[], or Long).

params.name: dataAddr
params.comment: the address of the data for this settings

methods.name: clearSetting
methods.comment: Clear the setting.

methods.javadoc:
Clear all settings at the given address.
@param dataAddr the address for this settings.
methods.name: clearAllSettings
methods.comment: Clear all settings at the given address.

methods.name: clearSettings
methods.comment: Clears all settings in the given address range.

params.name: start
params.comment: the first address of the range to clear

params.name: end
params.comment: the last address of the range to clear.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the progress monitor for this operation.

throws.comment: if the user cancels the operation.

methods.name: moveAddressRange
methods.comment: Move the settings in the range to the new start address.

params.name: fromAddr
params.comment: start address from where to move

methods.javadoc:
Returns all the Settings names for the given address.
@param dataAddr the address
methods.name: getNames
methods.comment: Returns all the Settings names for the given address.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if no settings are set for the given address.
@param dataAddr the address to test.
methods.name: isEmptySetting
methods.comment: Returns true if no settings are set for the given address.

methods.name: createKey
methods.comment:
Create a key from the table ID and the key obtained from the
 database table; the upper 8 bits indicates which data type table
 should be accessed.

return.comment:
long that has the upper 8 bits as the table ID, the rest of
 the bits are from the tableKey.

methods.name: deleteAddressRange
methods.comment: Removes all settings in the range

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the first address in the range.

params.name: endAddr
params.comment: the last address in the range.

throws.comment: if the user cancelled the operation.

methods.javadoc: @return true if manager is in the process of adding/creating a new type
methods.name: isCreatingDataType

return.comment: true if manager is in the process of adding/creating a new type

methods.javadoc:
This method is only invoked during an upgrade.
@param compilerSpec
methods.name: doSourceArchiveUpdates
methods.comment: This method is only invoked during an upgrade.

name: DataTypeManagerDB
comment: Base class for data type managers.
